headline: Hochul says data will guide mask mandate in New York
author: Nick Reisman
sentences: Opponents of the mandate believe the rule should not be enforced because Hochul lacks the power to do so; state officials have argued the Department of Health is given broad powers to protect public health.

Kathy Hochul on Friday indicated the future of mask wearing in schools, however, will be in large part linked to the number of kids who are vaccinated for the virus.
"The more children we have vaccinated, the safer they will be when they go to school at the time they get to where they won't need a mask anymore," she said.
We'll be making some announcements in the short term as we see these numbers progressing," she said on Friday during a weather and COVID-19 briefing.
A mask rule for indoor spaces was re-instituted in December as the omicron variant was beginning to show a steep rise in COVID-19 cases.
